Starting a Project Easier

This page serves as an introduction to the tools and frameworks used by the Interactive Developers to scaffold their projects and begin and maintain a quick and efficient workflow. Below you will find a brief synopsis of the most used frameworks and steps to install them.

Yeoman

Yeoman combines open source tools and streamlines aspects of the project development process. Yo will set up basic application file structures for you, just by entering one line in the Terminal. Some projects allow you to choose what frameworks you wish you use, for instance Bootstrap or SemanticUI, AngularJS or Backbone. Once you run the Yo command, your project file structure is created with the dependencies needed for the frameworks you specified already installed and ready to use.

Grunt

Grunt handles automated tasks like minification, compiliation, etc.

Grunt is mostly used to build and clean projects and to set up projects on a localhost. Your Gruntfile, which defines the Grunt tasks, can have a livereload task which will refresh the application in your browser as soon as the files are saved in your work environment. This is just one example of how the Grunt task manager can make your workflow faster and easier.

Bower

Bower fetches and installs packages and libraries from open-sources and keeps track of the packages in a compiled file, "bower.json", in your project's root directory.

Bower, along with NPM (Node Package Manager), speeds up the project creation procress. They download and manage your scripts so you don't have to do it manually.

Node.js

Node.js is the first and foremost tool to install.

Node.js handles the installation of open source applications through NPM (Node Package Manager), the package manager for the Node.js server platform.

Node functions as a warehouse of third-party applications, while NPM not only delivers the packages but installs the code and manages the code dependencies. All 'node_module' installations are run through the Terminal command line.

1. Travel to https://nodejs.org/

2. Click the install button and follow the directions

3. Make sure the package is installed into /usr/local/bin

Checkout their website for more information

Yeoman

Yeoman scaffolds high quality working web applications. Most projects made by the development team are first scaffolded with Yeoman, so browse through the Yeoman generators first for an existing project scaffold before building your own from scratch.

Yeoman combines several functions, e.g. creating a starter template, managing dependencies, and providing a local development server. AngularJS, Assemble, Backbone are just a few examples of project structures that can be instantiated with Yeoman.

1. Open the terminal

$ npm install -g yo bower grunt-cli

Grunt and Bower are components of Yeoman, no extra installation is needed. When Yo creates a project, a 'Gruntfile.js' and 'bower_components.json' are created in the root directory.

Checkout their website for more information

Sass

Sass is a stable, powerful CSS extension, which harbors benefits like allowing functionality available in Object Oriented languages.

Sass supports CSS variable declaration, nesting, mixins, arguments, and selector inheritance. Note: 'gem' is a Ruby declaration.

1. Open the terminal

$ gem install sass

**Gem should be preinstalled on Macs

2. If you get an error message, then use the sudo command to install the Sass gem

$ sudo gem install sass

3. Check installation

$ sass -v

The terminal should print out Sass 3.4.13

Checkout their website for more information

Handlebars.js

Handlebars builds semantic web page templates.

Handlebars.js is compatible with Mustache.js, but can handle extensibility and minimal logic with '#if', '#unless', '#with', and '#each' helpers.

Handlebars does not provide a global installation, but can be downloaded from handlebars.com or be installed through Bower.

To Manually install Handlebars.js:

1. Go to the website http://handlebarsjs.com/

2. Click the provided download button

The files will need to be added to the scripts folder in the project manually.

For Bower install, open the Terminal

$ bower install handlebars

or

$ bower install https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/

If you created an Assemble project, Handlebars files have already been imported.

Checkout their website for more information
